instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message:
It came as water damage but I can't see any sign of damage on the logicboard. When connecting a charger it takes 5V but no A. I took the board out and connect the charger then taking 20.66V, still no A

C3021 = 20.5V
C3020 = 20.5V
F3000 = 20.5V
C9073 = 12.6
PPBUS_G3H = 12.6V
PP3v3_G3H = 3.33V
PP1V8_SLPS2R = 1.8V
PP1V8_AWAKE = 1.8V

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

If board switches to 20V alone on the desk, then can be a problem with some peripheral device.
However, there should be something bad on the board too, as stays at 0A.
You should test if enter DFU mode.
Inspect audio board for corrosion (both sides).

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message:
Thanks for the reply. 
Can't see any corrosion. Can't enter DFU mode.

getting 3.2 and 1.8V on        R7610 & R7613 = 1.8V    -   R7611 = 3.299V
PP1V1_SLPS2R = 1.04V
PP0V8_SLPS2R  = 0.8V
PP3V3_AWAKE  = 3.3V
PP1V2_AWAKE  =1.2V
PMU_PVDDMAIN_EN = 3.3V
P3V3MAIN_PGOOD= 3.2V
PP3V_G3H_RTC  = 3.008V
PCH_RTC_RESET_L = 3.008V

Could you pls let me know which area I have to check 

[ATTACH type="full"]60013[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60015[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message:
Thanks, I cleaned the board one more time and now I have some signals. laptop turns on and A goes up to 2.8A but it restarts halfway through. I can see the Apple logo and then the loading bar then restarts.
[ATTACH type="full"]60019[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message: Also it's detecting it in DFU mode and I'm just reviving it.

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message: still restarting after reviving in DFU mode.

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message:
checked the board under the thermal camera and U7210 is getting hot as soon as I power on the laptop. 


[ATTACH type="full"]60023[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message: If no important data on its SSD, try restore.

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message: I tried to restore it, but it's randomly restarting and the heatsink is getting really hot. the A goes to 0 and the fan spins full speed for a second and then turns back on

threads.title: 820-01598-A not turning on - 20V 0A
threads.message:
If you get image, U7210 shouldn't be bad.
But may have some internal problem, change it.
